TNMrow.AJCCcriteria: Clinically inapparent tumor that is not palpable
Tumor incidental histologic finding in 5 percent or less of tissue resected
Tumor incidental histologic finding in more than 5 percent of tissue resected
Tumor identified by needle biopsy found in one or both sides, but not palpable
Tumor is palpable and confined within prostate
Tumor involves one-half of one side or less
Tumor involves more than one-half of one side but not both sides
Extraprostatic tumor that is not fixed or does not invade adjacent structures
Tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall
Extraprostatic extension (unilateral or bilateral) or microscopic invasion of bladder neck
Tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall
Clinically inapparent tumor that is not palpable
Tumor incidental histologic finding in 5% or less of tissue resected
Tumor incidental histologic finding in more than 5% of tissue resected
Tumor identified by needle biopsy found in one or both sides, but not palpable
Tumor is palpable and confined within prostate
Tumor involves one-half of one side or less
Tumor involves more than one-half of one side but not both sides
Extraprostatic tumor that is not fixed or does not invade adjacent structures
Tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall

p.note: Positive surgical margin should be indicated by an R1 descriptor, indicating residual microscopic disease.

Tumor incidental histologic finding in 5% or less of tissue resected
Tumor incidental histologic finding in more than 5% of tissue resected
Tumor identified by needle biopsy found in one or both sides, but not palpable
Tumor is palpable and confined within prostate
Tumor involves one-half of one side or less
Tumor involves more than one-half of one side but not both sides

Tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall
Extraprostatic extension (unilateral or bilateral) or microscopic invasion of bladder neck
Tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall

p.note: Positive surgical margin should be indicated by an R1 descriptor, indicating residual microscopic disease.

TNMrow.AJCCcriteria: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Other site(s) with or without bone disease
Microscopic evidence of nonregional lymph node(s) metastasis
Microscopic evidence of metastasis to other site(s) with or without bone disease

p.note: When more than one site of metastasis is present, the most advanced category is used. M1c is most advanced.

TNMrow.AJCCcriteria: Other site(s) with or without bone disease
Microscopic evidence of nonregional lymph node(s) metastasis
Microscopic evidence of metastasis to other site(s) with or without bone disease

p.note: When more than one site of metastasis is present, the most advanced category is used. M1c is the most advanced.

TNMrow.AJCCcriteria: Other site(s) with or without bone disease
Microscopic evidence of nonregional lymph node(s) metastasis
Microscopic evidence of metastasis to other site(s) with or without bone disease

p.note: When more than one site of metastasis is present, the most advanced category is used. M1c is the most advanced.

TNMrow.AJCCcriteria: Other site(s) with or without bone disease
Microscopic evidence of nonregional lymph node(s) metastasis
Microscopic evidence of metastasis to other site(s) with or without bone disease

p.note: When more than one site of metastasis is present, the most advanced category is used. M1c is the most advanced.

PSAdefinition.p: PSA values are used to assign this category.

strow.stentry: greater than or equal to 10, but less than 20

G_definition.p: Recently, the Gleason system has been compressed into so-called Grade Groups. 48
